subject: Programming
title: Big O and Performance
description: One-minute skill: Big O and Performance.

hook.text: Your search takes one second with 100 items. How long with a million? Big O tells you.

buildup.text: Big O notation describes how an operation's time grows as the data size increases.

discovery.text: O(1) means constant time. O(n) means linear. O(nÂ²) means quadratic â€” and potentially disastrous.

twist.text: Big O ignores constants. An O(n) algorithm with a huge constant can be slower than O(nÂ²) for small data.

climax.text: Choosing the right data structure often means choosing the right Big O for your most common operation.

punchline.text: Big O predicts how your code handles growth.

quiz.question: What does O(n) mean?
